8:00-9:00
Grade 1

Grade 2
11:00-12:00
Grade 3
1:00-2:00

If you are unable to attend during your scheduled time, please email Matt Flohr, James Burd Elementary Principal, at matthew.flohr@ship.k12.pa.us.

Thank you for your cooperation and support during this time.

Sincerely,

Matthew Flohr

The Superintendent Search has begun!
The Shippensburg Area School District Board of Directors seeks a dynamic individual with integrity, visionary leadership, superior communication skills, and outstanding administrative ability to lead a district of approximately 3500 students with an annual budget of approximately $48.5 million.
The desired candidate must possess experience in achieving high academic performance, creating academic equity, developing strong leaders, and sound school finance and business management. In addition, this candidate will have experience with curriculum development and implementation, knowledge of educational and innovative technology best practices, and success in community engagement and involvement.

Please visit the district website at www.shipk12.org and click on “Superintendent Search” for additional information.

In addition, this candidate will have experience with curriculum development and implementation, knowledge of educational and innovative technology best practices, and success in community engagement and involvement.

SHIPPENSBURG AREA SCHOOL DISTRICT CLOSED---MONDAY, AUGUST 21ST

A really exciting event is happening on Monday, Aug. 21 — a solar eclipse! For many, this may be a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to see our solar system in action. And it’s a great teaching moment for our kids.

A solar eclipse occurs when the moon passes between Earth and the sun, blocking our view of the sun. The eclipse will occur across the continental United States on Aug. 21. It will start on the West Coast and end on the East Coast. Everyone in the continental U.S. will be able to see at least a partial eclipse on this day.

As educators, the safety of our students is always our top priority. After conferring with various professionals and reading the news article below, Shippensburg Area School District has made the student-centered decision to close school on Monday, August 21st. More information including a make-up day will be forthcoming.

http://www.pennlive.com/news/2017/08/heres_how_the_solar_eclipse_co.html

Brownwyn Herb (JBES), Stevie Tsambiras (GBLUES), Jennifer Runk (NGES), Catherine Caffee (SASHS), Richard Hammaker (SAIS), and Shannon Keetch (SAMS) were all recognized for the volunteer work in each school building. Timothy Hess was named the district Volunteer of the Year.

Curtis Garland of the Shippensburg New-Chronicle was awarded the Excellence in the Education News Reporting.

And two wonderful teachers are retiring from SASD after many years of dedication, Janette Wolf and Debra Gross.

Thank you all for your time, dedication, and success for our students throughout this district and the Shippensburg community!

Two Shippensburg Area School District Programs Recognized by the Shippensburg University Study Council As Exemplary Programs!

Nancy Grayson and James Burd Elementary Schools' "Primary Wellness and Fitness Program" and Shippensburg Area Intermediate School's program titled, "The Learning Luau Literacy Program" were recognized earlier today at a sharing and recognition program at Shippensburg University.

The JBES/NGES Primary Wellness and Fitness Program curriculum was written/designed by teachers Mrs. Krystal Boyles and Mr. Jesse Haller. Mr. Haller and NGES Principal, Susan Martin, presented the program to an audience of educators earlier today. The curriculum is currently taught by Mr. Haller at NGES and Mr. Garcia at JBES.

SAIS was represented by Miss Grace Hockenberry, Mrs. Beth Jones, and Principal Teri Mowery to present their Literacy program and share it with other schools in PA.

Both schools were recognized for their Exemplary Program! Congratulations to all involved!!!

This past weekend Ms. Campbell and Mrs. Lawrence had the pleasure of taking Shippensburg high school students to the regional Science Olympiad Competition at Millersville University. This competition is aimed at exciting students for future careers in STEM fields. Our students built structures that were tested (such as robot arms, towers made of balsa wood, hovercrafts, electric vehicles, and helicopters), took challenging written exams in many fields (microbiology, astronomy, anatomy/physiology), and did hands-on labs (forensics, experimental design, chemistry) during this exciting day.

We are proud to report that our students earned medals in five of the division C events.

Ryzeson Maravich and Noah Stewart: 4th place in Anatomy and Physiology

Becca Light and Iris Kennedy: 2nd place in Chemistry Lab

Chandler Olson and Iris Kennedy: 4th place in Dynamic Planet

Emma Torija and Chandler Olson: 4th place in Electric Vehicle

Chandler Olson and Shaine Rotz: 4th place in Hovercraft
